name: 林郁修
objective:
This semester's Artificial Intelligence (AI) course will focus on Machine Learning (ML) and Deep Learning (DL) with related work in data science analytics. We will look at classic supervised and unsupervised learning methods, which will include Multi-Layer Perceptron (MLP), Deep Neural Networks/Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), and k-Means clustering. This course is designed for graduate students who are interested in AI and its applications in data science analytics. Students who take this course should have mathematical maturity of undergraduate curricula in science and engineering, including Calculus, Discrete Mathematics, Linear Algebra and programming language such as C/C++/MATLAB/Python. Teaching approaches conducted in this course emphasize analysis, modeling and
design principles of AI methodology. Case studies, engineering applications of AI in data science analytics, will also be covered in this course. Collaboration Policy & Honor Code: You are free to form study groups and discuss assignments and projects. However, you must write up assignments and code from scratch independently, and you must acknowledge in your submission all the students you discussed with. Honor code violations: Looking at the writeup or code of another student & Showing your writeup or code to another student.
